js/components/AddLayer.jsx.description:
Adds a menu entry that can be used by the web app user to add a layer to the map.
Only vector layers can be added. Supported formats for layers are GeoJSON, GPX and KML.

map.description: The ol3 map instance to add to.

strokeWidth.description: The stroke width in pixels used in the style for the uploaded data.

pointRadius.description: The point radius used for the circle style.

intl.description: i18n message strings. Provided through the application through context.

js/components/Bookmarks.jsx.description:
Adds the ability to retrieve spatial bookmarks.
A spatial bookmark consists of a name, an extent and a description.

map.description: The ol3 map instance on whose view we should navigate.

bookmarks.description:
The bookmark data. An array of objects with name, description and extent keys.
The extent should be in the view projection.

dots.description: Should we show indicators? These are dots to navigate the bookmark pages.

autoplaySpeed.description: delay between each auto scoll in ms.

animatePanZoom.description: Should we animate the pan and zoom operation?

animationDuration.description: The duration of the animation in milleseconds. Only relevant if animatePanZoom is true.

introTitle.description: The title on the introduction (first) page of the bookmarks.

introDescription.description: The description of the introduction (first) page of the bookmarks.

intl.description: i18n message strings. Provided through the application through context.

menu.description: Display as a menu drop down list.

showMarker.description: Should we display a marker for the bookmark? Default is true.

js/components/Chart.jsx.description: Allow for the creation of charts based on selected features of a layer.

charts.description:
An array of configuration objects. Configuration objects have title, categoryField, layer,
valueFields, displayMode and operation keys.
title is the title to display for the chart.
categoryField is the attribute to use as the category.
layer is the id property of the corresponding layer to use.
valueFields is an array of field names to use for displaying values in the chart.
displayMode defines how the feature attributes will be used to create the chart. When using a value of 0 (by feature), an element will
be added to the chart for each selected feature. When using a value of 1 (by category), selected features will be grouped according to
a category defined by the categoryField. When using a value of 2 (count by category) the chart will show the number of features in each
category.
The statistic function to use when displayMode is by category (1) is defined in the operation key.
A value of 0 means MIN, a value of 1 means MAX, a value of 2 means SUM and a value of 3 means AVG (Average).

combo.description: If true, show a combo box to select charts instead of dropdown button.

container.description: The id of the container to show when a chart is selected.

intl.description: i18n message strings. Provided through the application through context.

js/components/Edit.jsx.description: A component that allows creating new features, so drawing their geometries and setting feature attributes through a form.

strokeWidth.description: The stroke width in pixels used in the style for the created features.

pointRadius.description: The point radius used for the circle style.

intl.description: i18n message strings. Provided through the application through context.

js/components/Geocoding.jsx.description: Input field to search for placenames using a geocoding service (OSM nominatim).

maxResults.description: The maximum number of results to return on a search.

intl.description: i18n message strings. Provided through the application through context.

js/components/GeocodingResults.jsx.description: This component displays the results of geocoding search. The geocoding search is initiated by the Geocoding component.

map.description: The ol3 map on whose view to perform the center action.

zoom.description: The zoom level used when centering the view on a geocoding result.

intl.description: i18n message strings. Provided through the application through context.

js/components/Geolocation.jsx.description: Enable geolocation which uses the current position of the user in the map.

map.description: The ol3 map for which to change its view's center.

intl.description: i18n message strings. Provided through the application through context.

js/components/Globe.jsx.description: Adds a button to toggle 3D mode.

map.description: The ol3 map instance to work on.

js/components/HomeButton.jsx.description: A button to go back to the initial extent of the map.

map.description: The ol3 map for whose view the initial center and zoom should be restored.

intl.description: i18n message strings. Provided through the application through context.

js/components/ImageExport.jsx.description: Export the map as a PNG file.

map.description: The ol3 map to export as PNG.

intl.description: i18n message strings. Provided through the application through context.

js/components/LayerList.jsx.description: A list of layers in the map. Allows setting visibility and opacity.

map.description: The map whose layers should show up in this layer list.

showZoomTo.description: Should we show a button that allows the user to zoom to the layer's extent?

allowReordering.description: Should we allow for reordering of layers?

allowFiltering.description: Should we allow for filtering of features in a layer?

allowLabeling.description: Should we allow for labeling of features in a layer?

showGroupContent.description: Should we show the contents of layer groups?

showDownload.description: Should we show a download button for layers?

showOpacity.description: Should we show an opacity slider for layers?

intl.description: i18n message strings. Provided through the application through context.

js/components/LayerListItem.jsx.description: An item in the LayerList component.

map.description: The map in which the layer of this item resides.

layer.description: The layer associated with this item.

title.description: The title to show for the layer.

showZoomTo.description: Should we show a zoom to button for the layer?

allowReordering.description: Should we show up and down buttons to allow reordering?

allowFiltering.description: Should we allow for filtering of features in a layer?

allowLabeling.description: Should we allow for labeling of features in a layer?

showDownload.description: Should we show a download button?

children.description: The child items to show for this item.

showOpacity.description: Should we show an opacity slider for the layer?

onModalOpen.description: Called when a modal is opened by this layer list item.

onModalClose.description: Called when a modal is closed by this layer list item.

intl.description: i18n message strings. Provided through the application through context.

js/components/LayerSelector.jsx.description: A combobox to select a layer.

map.description: The map from which to extract the layers.

filter.description: A filter function to filter out some of the layers by returning false.

value.description: The default value of the layer selector, i.e. the layer to select by default.

js/components/MapTool.js.description:
A tool that manages interactions on the map. The interactions will be
activated and deactivated depending on toggleGroup.

map.description: The map onto which to activate and deactivate the interactions.

toggleGroup.description: The toggleGroup to use. When this tool is activated, all other tools in the same toggleGroup will be deactivated.

js/components/Measure.jsx.description: Adds area and length measure tools to the map.

intl.description: i18n message strings. Provided through the application through context.

js/components/Playback.jsx.description: Adds a slider to the map that can be used to select a given date, and modifies the visibility of layers and features depending on their timestamp and the current time.

map.description: The map whose time-enabled layers should be filtered. Time-enabled layers are layers that have a timeInfo property.

minDate.description: The minimum date to use for the slider field and the date picker.

maxDate.description: The maximum date to use for the slider field and the date picker.

interval.description: The time, in milliseconds, to wait in each position of the slider. Positions are defined by dividing the slider range by the number of intervals defined in the numIntervals parameter.

numIntervals.description: The number of intervals into which the full range of the slider is divided.

autoPlay.description: Should the playback tool start playing automatically?

intl.description: i18n message strings. Provided through the application through context.

js/components/QGISLegend.jsx.description: A component that shows a legend based on artefacts created by the QGIS plugin Web Application Builder.

map.description: The map from which to extract the layers.

legendBasePath.description: The base path (relative url) to use for finding the artefacts.

legendData.description: The label and image to use per layer. The object is keyed by layer name currently. For example: {'swamp': [['', '4_0.png']]}.

intl.description: i18n message strings. Provided through the application through context.

js/components/QGISPrint.jsx.description: A print component which is dependent on artefacts generated by QGIS Web Application Builder.

map.description: The ol3 map to use for printing.

layouts.description: An array of print layouts. Each layout is an object with keys such as: name, thumbnail, width, height and an array of elements.

resolutions.description: A list of resolutions from which the user can choose from. Please note that artefacts for all resolutions need to get pre-generated by QGIS.

thumbnailPath.description: The relative path where thumbnails of the print layouts can be found. Thumbnails are also generated by QGIS.

intl.description: i18n message strings. Provided through the application through context.

js/components/QueryBuilder.jsx.description: A component that allows users to perform queries on vector layers. Queries can be new queries, added to existing queries or users can filter inside of an existing query a.k.a. drill-down.

map.description: The ol3 map whose layers can be used for the querybuilder.

intl.description: i18n message strings. Provided through the application through context.

js/components/Select.jsx.description: The select tool allows users to select features in multiple layers at a time by drawing a rectangle.

intl.description: i18n message strings. Provided through the application through context.

js/components/WFST.jsx.description:
Allows users to make changes to WFS-T layers. This can be drawing new
features and deleting or modifying existing features. Only geometry
changes are currently supported, no attribute changes.
This depends on ol.layer.Vector with ol.source.Vector. The layer
needs to have isWFST set to true. Also a wfsInfo object needs to be
configured on the layer with the following properties:
- featureNS: the namespace of the WFS typename
- featureType: the name (without prefix) of the underlying WFS typename
- geometryType: the type of geometry (e.g. MultiPolygon)
- geometryName: the name of the geometry attribute
- url: the online resource of the WFS endpoint

map.description: The ol3 map whose layers can be used for the WFS-T tool.

intl.description: i18n message strings. Provided through the application through context.
